isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - ADJUSTMENT INSTRUCTIONS - INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCH WITH CLUTCH BRAKE

svcproc.title: INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCH WITH CLUTCH BRAKE

step1.para: Remove inspection cover at bottom of clutch housing.

With the clutch engaged (pedal up), measure the clearance between release bearing housing and the clutch brake (Release Travel). If the clearance is less than 1/2" or greater than 9/16" ( Figure 53), continue through Steps 3 and 4, otherwise skip to Step 5.
Release the clutch by fully depressing the clutch pedal.

Referring to the INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT MECHANISMS AND INSTRUCTIONS
for specific instructions for your given type of adjustment mechanism, advance the adjusting ring (pedal down) until a distance of 1/2" to 9/16" is attained between the release bearing housing and the clutch brake with the clutch pedal released (pedal up).

step2.para: If the clearance between the release bearing housing and the clutch brake is less than 1/2", rotate the adjusting ring counterclockwise to move the release bearing toward the engine.
If the clearance between the release bearing housing and the clutch brake is greater than 9/16", rotate the adjusting ring clockwise to move the release bearing toward the transmission.

step1.para: Apply a small amount of grease between the release bearing wear pads and the clutch release fork. Repeat this at normal service intervals.
